channel.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
channel.description:
I saw this on a google ad. The pricing seems much too good to be true, does anyone have any ideas about it?
SERVER SPECIFICATIONS
* 1 Linux Dedicated Server * AMD 64 Athlon 3400+* 4GB RAM 200GB HDD FE NIC
NETWORK SPECIFICATIONS
* 100Mbit/s Unmetered ON-NET (Server-to-Server) * 3.3Mbit/s Unmetered OFF-NET (Server-to-Internet) * 1 IP Address (XIP $1.50/each per month)
PLATFORM OS SPECIFICATIONS
* 64-bit Linux OS (Ubuntu Server 8.x Default) * For OS change contact sales prior to ordering. * Secure Shell (Full Root Access)
SERVICE SPECIFICATIONS / ORDER
* Unmanaged / Self-Managed Server * Free Setup 24 hours * Simple Pricing Structure * Subscription Month-to-Month * Total Package MRC $50.00 USD Per Month
I am paying MUCH more per month than that for 2.0Mbit/s and I own the server....
http://www.leeware.com/google/basic.html

item.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
item.dc:creator: @Ryequis Ryequis_
item.description:
@Ryequis wrote:

I donno if its true or not, if it is then that would be tight. But yeah you should diffidently look into it.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:26, topic:246721”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=325682.msg2555718#msg2555718 date=1227894809]
Oh wait. Let’s assume a dude named John Adams makes cars that own all other cars, but he’s shit at designing websites. He gets great reviews, and he’s the number one on the Top Gear fastest cars lists etc…

Would that mean that it sucks? I think not.
[/quote]

No, but it would mean he dosen’t take his business seriously, or he would pay someone to design him a good website.[/quote]

In most cases your statement is true, but in some cases it isn’t. This being so cheap (I don’t know anything about servers and their specs) could also mean that there simply is no/hardly any service. As jme quoted, that’s probably the case. The hoster just offers hosting, without service. To cut the costs even more, he made the site himself. This only indicates that he isn’t good with the graphic side of web design.

But then again, if the specs are bad (which I don’t know anything about) you’ll find that that is the reason for the price.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I didn’t even see the website, I’m not interested in crap specced servers.

My comment was directed at the hypothetical situation with “John Adams” - hence quoting it.

Read full topic

Oh wait. Let’s assume a dude named John Adams makes cars that own all other cars, but he’s shit at designing websites. He gets great reviews, and he’s the number one on the Top Gear fastest cars lists etc…

Would that mean that it sucks? I think not.
[/quote]

No, but it would mean he dosen’t take his business seriously, or he would pay someone to design him a good website.[/quote]

His site is perfect. You’re completely off-base.

Basic website with great reviews > some flashy website with shit reviews.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

My customer-base is largely self-sufficient. Because I run a relatively large infrastructure I communicate problems and issues to Individuals as problems and issues are likely to only impact certain users and will remain irrelevent to all others.

Therefore, If you need a certain level of comfort i.e. 24/7 support you should probably select a provider that offers that.

Read full topic

item.title: Dedicated Server Pricing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

thefalloffuckingtroy.:

i don’t give a flying fuck what the reviews say, i wouldn’t trust them by just reading the website. the layout is done poorly, no sponsors or anything, its just shit like that, that makes it obvious its a piece of shit regardless of anything.

If a hosting company had ‘sponsors’ I would be suspicious of them just for that.
